One Level Up Top Level

replication/syncrep_scanner.l - pgsql17devel-backend

  1. %top{
  2. /*-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3. *
  4. * syncrep_scanner.l
  5. *      a lexical scanner for synchronous_standby_names
  6. *
  7. * Portions Copyright (c) 1996-2024, PostgreSQL Global Development Group
  8. * Portions Copyright (c) 1994, Regents of the University of California
  9. *
  10. *
  11. * IDENTIFICATION
  12. *      src/backend/replication/syncrep_scanner.l
  13. *
  14. *-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  15. */
  16. #include "postgres.h"

  18. #include "lib/stringinfo.h"
  19. #include "nodes/pg_list.h"

  21. /*
  22. * NB: include syncrep_gram.h only AFTER including syncrep.h, because syncrep.h
  23. * includes node definitions needed for YYSTYPE.
  24. */
  25. #include "replication/syncrep.h"
  26. #include "syncrep_gram.h"
  27. }

  29. %{
  30. /* Avoid exit() on fatal scanner errors (a bit ugly -- see yy_fatal_error) */
  31. #undef fprintf
  32. #define fprintf(file, fmt, msg)  fprintf_to_ereport(fmt, msg)

  34. static void
  35. fprintf_to_ereport(const char *fmt, const char *msg)
  36. {
  37.     ereport(ERROR, (errmsg_internal("%s", msg)));
  38. }

  40. /* Handles to the buffer that the lexer uses internally */
  41. static YY_BUFFER_STATE scanbufhandle;

  43. static StringInfoData xdbuf;

  45. /* LCOV_EXCL_START */

  47. %}

  49. %option 8bit
  50. %option never-interactive
  51. %option nodefault
  52. %option noinput
  53. %option nounput
  54. %option noyywrap
  55. %option warn
  56. %option prefix="syncrep_yy"

  58. /*
  59. * <xd> delimited identifiers (double-quoted identifiers)
  60. */
  61. %x xd

  63. space            [ \t\n\r\f\v]

  65. digit            [0-9]
  66. ident_start        [A-Za-z\200-\377_]
  67. ident_cont        [A-Za-z\200-\377_0-9\$]
  68. identifier        {ident_start}{ident_cont}*

  70. dquote            \"
  71. xdstart            {dquote}
  72. xdstop            {dquote}
  73. xddouble        {dquote}{dquote}
  74. xdinside        [^"]+

  76. %%
  77. {space}+    { /* ignore */ }

  79.     /* brute-force case insensitivity is safer than relying on flex -i */

  81. [Aa][Nn][Yy]            { return ANY; }
  82. [Ff][Ii][Rr][Ss][Tt]    { return FIRST; }

  84. {xdstart}    {
  85.                 initStringInfo(&xdbuf);
  86.                 BEGIN(xd);
  87.         }
  88. <xd>{xddouble} {
  89.                 appendStringInfoChar(&xdbuf, '"');
  90.         }
  91. <xd>{xdinside} {
  92.                 appendStringInfoString(&xdbuf, yytext);
  93.         }
  94. <xd>{xdstop} {
  95.                 syncrep_yylval.str = xdbuf.data;
  96.                 xdbuf.data = NULL;
  97.                 BEGIN(INITIAL);
  98.                 return NAME;
  99.         }
  100. <xd><<EOF>> {
  101.                 syncrep_yyerror("unterminated quoted identifier");
  102.                 return JUNK;
  103.         }

  105. {identifier} {
  106.                 syncrep_yylval.str = pstrdup(yytext);
  107.                 return NAME;
  108.         }

  110. {digit}+    {
  111.                 syncrep_yylval.str = pstrdup(yytext);
  112.                 return NUM;
  113.         }

  115. "*"        {
  116.                 syncrep_yylval.str = "*";
  117.                 return NAME;
  118.         }

  120. ","            { return ','; }
  121. "("            { return '('; }
  122. ")"            { return ')'; }

  124. .            { return JUNK; }
  125. %%

  127. /* LCOV_EXCL_STOP */

  129. /* Needs to be here for access to yytext */
  130. void
  131. syncrep_yyerror(const char *message)
  132. {
  133.     /* report only the first error in a parse operation */
  134.     if (syncrep_parse_error_msg)
  135.         return;
  136.     if (yytext[0])
  137.         syncrep_parse_error_msg = psprintf("%s at or near \"%s\"",
  138.                                            message, yytext);
  139.     else
  140.         syncrep_parse_error_msg = psprintf("%s at end of input",
  141.                                            message);
  142. }

  144. void
  145. syncrep_scanner_init(const char *str)
  146. {
  147.     Size        slen = strlen(str);
  148.     char       *scanbuf;

  150.     /*
  151.      * Might be left over after ereport()
  152.      */
  153.     if (YY_CURRENT_BUFFER)
  154.         yy_delete_buffer(YY_CURRENT_BUFFER);

  156.     /*
  157.      * Make a scan buffer with special termination needed by flex.
  158.      */
  159.     scanbuf = (char *) palloc(slen + 2);
  160.     memcpy(scanbuf, str, slen);
  161.     scanbuf[slen] = scanbuf[slen + 1] = YY_END_OF_BUFFER_CHAR;
  162.     scanbufhandle = yy_scan_buffer(scanbuf, slen + 2);

  164.     /* Make sure we start in proper state */
  165.     BEGIN(INITIAL);
  166. }

  168. void
  169. syncrep_scanner_finish(void)
  170. {
  171.     yy_delete_buffer(scanbufhandle);
  172.     scanbufhandle = NULL;
  173. }
